gov.va.med.srcalc.security

Class VistaAuthenticationProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.va.med.srcalc.security.VistaAuthenticationProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AccessVerifyAuthenticationProvider, CcowTokenAuthenticationProvider

    public abstract class VistaAuthenticationProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider
    An AuthenticationProvider that authenticates a user with VistA. Subclasses implement various authentication mechanisms (e.g., Access/Verify codes, etc.).

      • authenticate

        public org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authenticate(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication providedAuth)
                                                              throws org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException

        Authenticates the user with VistA.

        For this method to perform authentication, the passed Authentication object must have an instance of SrcalcWebAuthnDetails (with a known division) as the details object. If not, it is not a programming error: this method will just return null. (Spring Security specifies this behavior.)

        Note: Subclasses may put further constraints on the given Authentication object. Consult their documentation.

        Specified by:
        authenticate in interface org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider
        Parameters:
        providedAuth - contains the user's information necessary for authentication
        Returns:
        A fully-populated UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken if authentication succeeds, or null if the above criteria are not met.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException - if authentication fails

      • authenticate

        protected abstract org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authenticate(org.springframework.security.core.Authentication providedAuth,
                                                            SrcalcWebAuthnDetails authDetails)
                                                                          throws org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException
        Template method to authenticate the user given a generic Authentication and an SrcalcWebAuthnDetails.
        Parameters:
        providedAuth - contains the user's information necessary for authentication
        authDetails - an SrcalcWebAuthnDetails indicating a known division
        Returns:
        A fully-populated UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken if authentication succeeds
        Throws:
        org.springframework.security.core.AuthenticationException - if authentication fails

      • supports

        public boolean supports(java.lang.Class<?> authentication)
        Returns true if, and only if, objects of the given class can be treated as UsernamePasswordAuthenticationToken objects.
        Specified by:
        supports in interface org.springframework.security.authentication.AuthenticationProvider
